abstracts.cdata!:
The Teacher Education and Teacher
            Development Project for Sri Lanka had the following ratings:
            the outcome was satisfactory, the sustainability was likely,
            the institutional development impact was substantial, and
            the Bank and borrower performance were both satisfactory.
            Following are some of the lessons learned from the project:
            Successful project implementation depends crucially on
            ensuring that adequate trained staff in project and
            financial management, and procurement are in place prior to
            commencing implementation. To ensure successful
            implementation of policy reforms which depend upon
            completion of prior inputs, broad stakeholder consultations
            are needed as well as sufficient time provided for
            sequencing critical implementation activities. Successful
            project implementation requires the establishment, at
            project start, of an effective monitoring and evaluation
            system with a clear delineation of responsibilities for
            collecting, processing and dissemination of data on the key
            performance indicators at specified periods, with special
            attention to project outputs and outcomes.
